      Caused by undefined player error.

      Occurs when failed to connect to the server.

      static String PLAYLIST_STUCK
      This error occurs when the playlist is stuck.
      static String SLOW_INTERNET_SPEED
      This error occurs when the speed of internet connection between the client and the server is too slow to do the operation (e.g. playing a video content) normally.
      static String SOCKET_CONNECTION_ERROR
      Error occurs when client tries to establish the socket connection.
      static String TEMPORARILY_UNAVAILABLE
      Occurs when Straas server has some trouble temporarily or there is something wrong with the broadcaster of the live event.
      static String TOO_MANY_REQUESTS
      Too many requests for the server, please try again later.
      static String UNAUTHORIZED
      The user is unauthorized because the token in Identity is invalid or expired.
      static String UNKNOWN
      Occurs when unexpected error happened.

        public static final String NETWORK_ERROR
        Occurs when failed to connect to the server.

        One of the error message either from subscribing list info, or from PlaybackStateCompat.getErrorMessage() when PlaybackStateCompat.getState() is PlaybackStateCompat.STATE_ERROR.
        See Also:
        MediaBrowserCompat.subscribe(String, MediaBrowserCompat.SubscriptionCallback), MediaBrowserCompat.subscribe(String, Bundle, MediaBrowserCompat.SubscriptionCallback), Constant Field Values

      • DATA_SOURCE_ERROR

        public static final String DATA_SOURCE_ERROR

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SLOW_INTERNET_SPEED

        public static final String SLOW_INTERNET_SPEED
        This error occurs when the speed of internet connection between the client and the server is too slow to do the operation (e.g. playing a video content) normally. Please check your network condition and try again.

        One of the error message from PlaybackStateCompat.getErrorMessage() when PlaybackStateCompat.getState() is PlaybackStateCompat.STATE_ERROR.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DATA_DESERIALIZE_ERROR

        public static final String DATA_DESERIALIZE_ERROR
        Caused by SDK can't handle the current server response format. Maybe you should upgrade the SDK.

        One of the error message either from subscribing list info, or from PlaybackStateCompat.getErrorMessage() when PlaybackStateCompat.getState() is PlaybackStateCompat.STATE_ERROR.
        See Also:
        MediaBrowserCompat.subscribe(String, MediaBrowserCompat.SubscriptionCallback), MediaBrowserCompat.subscribe(String, Bundle, MediaBrowserCompat.SubscriptionCallback), Constant Field Values

      • NOT_FOUND

        public static final String NOT_FOUND
        This happens when the media you are trying to access is not found on the server, or it hasn't been loaded to client from the server. If it's a playlist item, you can only play the content you have subscribed.

        One of the error message either from subscribing list info, or from PlaybackStateCompat.getErrorMessage() when PlaybackStateCompat.getState() is PlaybackStateCompat.STATE_ERROR.
        See Also:
        MediaBrowserCompat.subscribe(String, MediaBrowserCompat.SubscriptionCallback), MediaBrowserCompat.subscribe(String, Bundle, MediaBrowserCompat.SubscriptionCallback), Constant Field Values

      • UNAUTHORIZED

        public static final String UNAUTHORIZED
